articles.author: Novinky.cz
articles.title: Rescue of the submarine Titan from the bottom: The greatest hope may be a drone, but there are many problems - Novinky.cz
articles.description: The chances of rescuing the crew of the lost submarine Titan are limited, according to experts, as the wreck of the Titanic, which the submarine was heading towards, lies over 3,800 meters deep. Only a few crewed vessels can reach such depths, with the best hope being unmanned underwater drones. The US Navy has a submersible rescue vehicle that can reach a depth of around 600 meters, but it is unlikely to be able to rescue the crew of the Titan. The time factor is also a problem, as the wreck of the Titanic is approximately 600 kilometers from the Canadian coast, and ships that can carry a CURV-21 type vehicle do not move faster than about 30 kilometers per hour.

articles.description: EA announced that EA Games will be renamed EA Entertainment in a move that splits it and EA Sports into two separate organizations encompassing many of EA's major studios.

articles.author: Edital Concursos Brasil
articles.title: Keep an eye on the FINE! New radars identify bad drivers from a distance - Public Notice Contests Brazil
articles.description: São Paulo and Curitiba have found an innovative solution to combat bad drivers who try to cheat fixed speed cameras. Using Doppler Effect technology, the new radars can identify these drivers at a considerable distance after the equipment. Unlike conventional radars that measure vehicle speed through sensors on the asphalt, the new radars use electromagnetic waves to capture bad drivers. These radars can measure vehicle speed up to 50 meters after passing the installation point and can also record images that prove prohibited lane changes and red light violations. São Paulo and Curitiba are already using these new radars, and they may be installed in other cities in the future. However, they are currently in an experimental period and cannot generate fines for bad drivers.

articles.author: LA NACION
articles.title: A journalist recalled the talk in which the CEO entrusted him with a detail of the submarine: "It has elements of MacGyver" – LA NACION
articles.description: The missing submarine Titan, which was on an expedition to view the remains of the Titanic, is controlled by a video game joystick, according to a journalist who traveled in the sub last summer. The CEO of Ocean Gate, the company that created the sub, showed the joystick to the journalist during the trip. The joystick is believed to be a modified version of a Logitech Gamepad F710. While some may be alarmed by the use of a video game controller to operate a sub that can dive up to 4,000 meters, it is not uncommon for gamepads to be used in naval and other technologies.

articles.author: Andro4all
articles.title: One of the best video players for Android is free for a few hours - Andro4all
articles.description: For a limited time, the Reproductor de video HD Pro app for Android is available for free on the Google Play Store. This app is a highly rated video player that can play Ultra HD and 4K videos in a variety of formats. It has a simple design, a 5-band equalizer, and the ability to play videos in a pop-up window. The app is usually priced at €3.49 but is currently available for free.

articles.author: Hardware
articles.title: Federal Revenue announces increase in the value of tax on software - Hardware
articles.description: The Brazilian Federal Revenue announced a significant increase in taxation on software, marking the third time such a measure has been implemented this year. The new rule establishes that all purchases and updates of software licenses from outside the country are now subject to the collection of two specific taxes, PIS and Cofins-Importation. This change is a response to a recent decision by the Supreme Federal Court (STF), which changed the way software is classified for tax purposes. The effective taxation can exceed 10%, and lawyers from various companies are questioning the new rules, potentially leading to legal disputes.

articles.description: This article discusses the popularity of WhatsApp and the desire of some users to have WhatsApp Plus Azul, which is not yet as advanced as the original WhatsApp. The article provides a link for users to download the APK for WhatsApp Plus Azul and warns of the possibility of future bans. It also provides a link for users to contact WhatsApp for support. The article concludes by encouraging readers to stay up-to-date with new WhatsApp features and tools.

articles.author: Cryptonews FR
articles.title: 3 Reasons Bitcoin Price Could Keep Rising - Cryptonews UK
articles.description: Bitcoin's value has been volatile over the past eight months, dropping to less than $17,000 in November 2022 before rising to over $24,000 in February and reaching a peak of $31,000 in April before dropping below $27,000. However, according to Michael Van de Poppe's article in Cointelegraph, recent macroeconomic news suggests that the dollar will not rise in the coming months, which could lead to a rise in Bitcoin's value. BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has also filed a request with the SEC to create a Bitcoin ETF, which could lead to a continued rise in Bitcoin's value. The SEC's recent regulatory action against Binance and Coinbase has also led to a renewed interest in Bitcoin as a financial refuge.

articles.author: ComputerBase
articles.title: Gigabyte A620I AX: Potentially cheap ITX motherboard for Ryzen 7000 - ComputerBase
articles.description: Gigabyte is set to release its first A620 mini-ITX motherboard for Ryzen 7000, potentially offering a lower entry price than the current limited selection starting at €240. The A620I AX board features a simple design with no RGB-LEDs, two DDR5 DIMM slots, a PCIe-4.0-x16 slot for a graphics card, and a single M.2 slot with PCIe 4.0 x4/x2 and a cooling plate. The board also offers DisplayPort and HDMI for integrated graphics, a USB-C port, a 10 Gbit/s USB-A port, and two USB-A ports with 5 Gbit/s. The A620M DS3H and A620M H/S2H are three new micro-ATX models with the A620 chipset, offering varying levels of features and prices.

articles.author: SMARTmania.cz
articles.title: Are you eagerly awaiting the new iPhone SE? Maybe you won't see it - SMARTmania.cz
articles.description: This article discusses the possibility of a fourth generation iPhone SE, but analysts believe it is unlikely due to Apple's focus on developing its own 5G modem. The current iPhone SE, released in 2022, is praised for its compact size and affordable price, but may not see a design update anytime soon. Despite this, current owners need not worry about their device becoming outdated due to Apple's long software support.

articles.author: La Voz del Interior
articles.title: Unusual: a singer was seriously injured after a cell phone was thrown at her face
articles.description: Bebe Rexha, a Grammy-nominated pop singer, was hit in the face by a cellphone thrown from the audience during a show in New York. She was immediately taken to the hospital and received medical attention. The singer later reassured her fans on social media that she was okay and out of danger. The person who threw the phone was arrested and charged with assault and other charges. Despite the incident, Rexha will continue her tour and perform as scheduled.

articles.author: Sky News Arabia سكاي نيوز عربية
articles.title: إسكات المتصلين المجهولين.. واتساب يطلق الخاصية المنتظرة - Sky News Arabia سكاي نيوز عربية
articles.description: WhatsApp has launched a new feature called "mute unknown callers" to help users block unwanted calls and increase privacy. The feature will not block calls from unknown numbers but will silence them and show a missed call notification instead. Users can activate the feature by going to WhatsApp settings, selecting "privacy" and then "calls" and enabling "mute unknown callers". The move comes after millions of users around the world complained of receiving suspicious calls from international numbers, which put the app's reputation at risk. In addition to the new feature, WhatsApp has also launched a privacy settings review to help users stay informed about all available protection options in the app.

articles.author: TechTudo
articles.title: Google Street View helps people find dead relatives; test - TechTudo
articles.description: Users on Twitter are sharing images from Google Street View with photos of deceased relatives who were registered on the platform. This trend, which had already gone viral in 2021, has once again moved and touched social media users earlier this week. The initiative has led many users to search for records of other deceased relatives on Google's tool. As a result, several profiles have shared images of family and friends in the places they used to visit before they died and moved the Internet.
